import React, { useState, useEffect } from "react"; import { useParams } from "react-router-dom"; import { StarIcon } from '@heroicons/react/20/solid'; import { RadioGroup, Radio } from '@headlessui/react'; const products = [ { id: 1, name: "Nike Air Force 1'07 Fresh", price: "₹11,000.00", imageSrc: "https://static.nike.com/a/images/c_limit,w_592,f_auto/t_product_v1/4b24bc11-4ea0-4ee5-8d16-aa58b518475b/AIR+FORCE+1+%2707+FRESH.png", description: "A fresh take on the classic Nike Air Force 1.", colors: ["White", "Black", "Red"], sizes: ["S", "M", "L", "XL"], highlights: ["Ultra-comfortable", "Iconic Design", "Durable"] }, { id: 2, name: "Nike Air Force 1'07", price: "₹7,000.00", imageSrc: "https://static.nike.com/a/images/c_limit,w_592,f_auto/t_product_v1/21d38052-598b-44f6-a857-123c9f72b015/AIR+FORCE+1+%2707.png", description: "Classic Nike Air Force 1 with timeless appeal.", colors: ["Black", "White"], sizes: ["M", "L", "XL"], highlights: ["Premium Quality", "Soft Leather", "Stylish Design"] }, // Add more products as needed... ]; export default function ProductOverview() { const { id } = useParams(); // Get the product ID from the URL const [selectedProduct, setSelectedProduct] = useState(null); useEffect(() => { const product = products.find((prod) => prod.id === parseInt(id)); setSelectedProduct(product); }, [id]); // Update product when id changes if (!selectedProduct) { return
Loading...

  2. {selectedProduct.name}
